page.title: 15BREAGE CHURCH
page.content: The Church is named after St. Breaca, a female Saint who came from Ireland. The earliest building on the site was probably a wooden oratory. The earliest vicar known was in the year 1219. The present Church building was built between 1416 and 1466. There are many interesting features. These include wall paintings inside the Church which were originally completed in 1470. They depict St. Christopher carrying a Christ child and a number of fragmentary scenes. These were covered over during Tudor times and rediscovered in Victorian times. There is a small amount of stained glass which survived Cromwell's soldiers. There is also a King Charles Letter written in thanks to his loyal Cornish subjects in 1643.
